intro: Pholidia leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leafed hibiscus, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, white to pale pink flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its floral structure includes five petals and a prominent central stigma, typical of the Malvaceae family. The plant is also noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
